result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler W Shearer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution Request and Order to Disburse in the amount of $531.80
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Huber/work release notification

Cases 14CF86 & 14CF234 called together at 8:43 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tyler W Shearer in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Arguments by ADA Hall; submits victim impact statement; Sentencing arguments by Atty Ahmad
Statements by Tracy Shearer

On Count #1-14CF86, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses
, at least 1x/mth for the 1st 12 months
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Mason Koehn, Lupe Medina, David Maney or Amanda Schreiter
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No contact with any know drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $
268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge 
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $110 buy money reimbursement 
--To pay $50 drug testing fee

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement under 973.015, upon successful completion of probation; Defendant must petition the Court to have expungement executed after completion of probation.

On Counts #2 & #3-14CF234, the Court sentences the Defendant to: 
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, each count, concurrent, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 12/29/14 by 6:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--1 day credit for time served given
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count) + $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count) = $886 + $53.18 restitution processing fee = $939.18; due in $35 increments per month beginning 12/31/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay results in 40 days jail, with Huber, consecutive. 
--To pay $531.80 restitution, payable to Enterprise Car Rental: APPLY CASH BOND FROM CASE 14CF86 and remainder to be used for costs on 14CF86
Court presents basis and denies expungement
Recess: 9:32 am
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF86 & 14CF234 called together at 9:58 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tyler W Shearer in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CF86 & Counts #2 & #3 -14CF234; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 - 14CF86 & Count #1 - 14CF234
Atty Ahmad requests matter be set out approx. 30 days for sentencing, presents basis
ADA Beck: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Shearer that his bond/conditions of release remain effect
Recess: 10:10 am

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Defendant signed bond on 7/14/14, original bond was returned to COC by JCSD on 7/15/14

Case called at 1:18 pm
Defendant Tyler W Shearer in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that SPD is appearing for bond purposes only, they did not conduct an evaluation.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct. Defendant indicates address is County Rd K.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Amanda Schreiter
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-Booking today at JCSD
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 7/17/14 at 3:00 pm.

Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1- #3.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 1:29 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 8/13/14 at 10:20 am
